Text:
A note about installation. My computer had Fedora 16 installed on the hard disk drive when I first tried to use these disks to reinstall Windows 7. The installer gave me an error code "F3-FF00-0026". The installer has a "Wipe the disk clean" option but it also gave me an error code. I booted from a Knoppix CD and used the "dd" command as follows:

# dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sda bs=1k count=1k

This zeroed out the hard disk drive's partition table. Then the Toshiba restore disks worked fine.

If you don't want to use Knoppix then the Ultimate Boot CD:

http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/

has several manufacturers' hard disk drive tools on it. Most of these tools have an option to zero out the partition table or the entire drive.
